meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The insignificancies of the pebble made it easy to overlook.
meanings.sent2: She realized the insignificancies of her worries when faced with real challenges.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics highlighted the insignificancies of the mouse's fears.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of the universe, our daily problems are mere insignificancies.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the insignificancies of punctuation errors in the overall writing quality.

meanings.definition: Things that are insignificant or unimportant.
meanings.sent1: He cluttered his desk with various insignificancies that he never used.
meanings.sent2: The box contained a mix of insignificancies and treasures from her childhood.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the importance of the insignificancies in life.
meanings.sent4: The old attic was filled with forgotten insignificancies of past generations.
meanings.sent5: She decided to declutter her life by getting rid of all the insignificancies that cluttered her space.
